Irisbond Duo API
  • notitle
Integrating Irisbond Duo API in your project

C++

To integrate the API in C++ the following files are required:

  • IrisbondAPI.lib
  • IrisbondAPI.dll
  • PGRFlyCapture.dll
  • include/IrisbondAPI.h
  • include/defines.h
  • Irisbond Duo API Drivers Setup x.y.z.exe

Before getting in touch with the source code, the eye tracker drivers and dependencies must be installed on the computer. "Irisbond Duo API Drivers Setup x.y.z.exe" will install the camera drivers, and some Visual C++ redistributable packages. Once they are installed, the computer will be ready to run the API.

In order to check that the computer is ready to run the API, IrisbondAPITestCS.exe is provided. It starts the API and shows the image from the camera, among many other things. If the program doesn't start, it will show an error code with more information about the reason to fail. If reinstalling the drivers doesn't work, our technical department can help troubleshooting the problem.

In the project, the API headers must be included. The file "IrisbondAPI.h" is required. It will include "defines.h" so there is no need to include it again.

Moreover, the API import library "IrisbondAPI.lib" has to be linked.

In the build directory, IrisbondAPI.dll and PGRFlyCapture.dll must be deployed.

When everything is done, the project and computer will be ready to start the eye tracker.

C#

To integrate the API in C# the following files are required:

  • IrisbondAPI.dll
  • PGRFlyCapture.dll
  • IrisbondAPITestCS/IrisbondDuo.cs
  • Irisbond Duo API Drivers Setup x.y.z.exe

Before getting in touch with the source code, the eye tracker drivers and dependencies must be installed on the computer. "Irisbond Duo API Drivers Setup x.y.z.exe" will install the camera drivers, and some Visual C++ redistributable packages. Once they are installed, the computer will be ready to run the API.

In order to check that the computer is ready to run the API, IrisbondAPITestCS.exe is provided. It starts the API and shows the image from the camera, among many other things. If the program doesn't start, it will show an error code with more information about the reason to fail. If reinstalling the drivers doesn't work, our technical department can help troubleshooting the problem.

In the project, the API functions must be imported by including the file "IrisbondDuo.cs". The class IrisbondDuo contains all the functions from the API.

Important: Some functions, like getHardwareNumber(), are not public by default. Instead, getHWNumber() is provided in this case. getHWNumber() returns a string which is easier to manage from C# than a pointer. Anyway, getHardwareNumber() can be made public if required.

In the build directory, IrisbondAPI.dll and PGRFlyCapture.dll must be deployed.

When everything is done, the project and computer will be ready to start the eye tracker.

There are at least 2 ways to check that the API has all the required dependencies to run (in C#):

  • One is to use try/catch when starting the API. If there is at least one dependency missing, an exception will raise.
  • The other one is to try to load the API dynamically with Loadlibrary. Based on this method, a function is provided in the IrisbondAPI.WinAPI class
    bool ApiHasAllDependencies()
    This function can be called before calling any API functions, to be sure that the API is ready to receive calls.
